resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
liyafan82 opened a new pull request #9964:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/9964


   Currently, the `ValueVector#getObject` API supports covariance for primitive types.
   For example, `IntVector#getObject` returns `Integer` while `BitVector#getObject` returns `Boolean`.
   
   For complex types, we should also support covariance. For example, `ListVector#getObject` should return a List
   
   This will help reduce unnecessary casts, and enforce type safety.


--

   Looks good!
   
   IMHO, does this PR change the signature of API a bit? Hopefully, the change does not affect existing code practically.

liyafan82 commented on pull request #9964:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/9964#issuecomment-817430701


   > Looks good!
   > 
   > IMHO, does this PR change the signature of API a bit? Hopefully, the change does not affect existing code practically.
   
   @kiszk Thanks for your feedback. Hopefully, it should not affect existing code, as the new return type `List/Map` is a sub-type of the original return type `Object`. 
   If we change the return type in the other direction, client code can be affected. 


--

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Currently, the {{ValueVector#getObject}} API supports covariance for primitive types.
For example, {{IntVector#getObject}} returns {{Integer}} while {{BitVector#getObject}} returns {{Boolean}}.

For complex types, we should also support covariance. For example, {{ListVector#getObject}} should return a {{List}}

This will help reduce unnecessary casts, and enforce type safety.
fields.summary: [Java] ValueVector#getObject should support covariance for complex types
